job_description:

• Lead full-stack development across backend services, APIs, and modern web applications.

• US citizen or green card holder: This position requires access to documentation that is controlled by the export laws of the United States.
• Candidates are required to provide proof of either US citizenship, Permanent US residency, or classification as a protected individual as defined in 8USC 1324b(a)(3).
• Education: Electrical Engineering graduate (minimum Bachelor degree or equivalent), open to other technical degrees and higher levels of scholastic achievement Semiconductor Knowledge: General knowledge of semiconductor power products and radiation-hardened/transient-tolerant semiconductors is a plus Technical Communication: Strong skills in creating and conveying technical product details to various audiences Industry Interest: Passion for learning about space and defense applications, and high-reliability electronics Marketing Skills: Some knowledge of marketing principles in technology or semiconductor industries is a plus Previous Work Experience: Engineering Internship or junior level post-graduation Engineering job is a plus Collaboration: Strong cross-departmental collaboration and project management skills preferred Software Proficiency: Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite and presentation software Product Types: Space-grade and high-reliability power Transistors, ICs and Diodes.

job_title: New College Grad - FE Automotive Product Quality Engineer
job_description:
• New College Grad - Global Quality Signal Integrity Qualification EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 2 days ago New College Grad - DRAM Device and Process Integration EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 11 days ago New College Grad - Design Verification Engineer, DRAMBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 22 days ago New College Grad - Wet Etch Equipment EngineerManassas, Virginia, United States of AmericaPosted 2 days ago New College Grad - Change Management EngineerManassas, Virginia, United States of AmericaPosted 3 days ago Demonstrated ability to maintain strong and open relationships with peer and other functional managers New College Grad - IT Software Support EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 8 days ago New College Grad - RAM RDA Process Engineer ID1Boise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 2 days ago.
• Perform Data Mining of Reliability Fails and collaborate with Yield Enhancement to generate defect pareto and drive fab process improvement action in collaboration with process integration.
• Act as SME in reliability fail modes and its associated detection, drives, and engage in quality projects for overall DPM reduction.

• Proficiency, experience, and knowledge relating to product and test wafer capacity modeling, wafer at risk modeling, Failure Mode Effect Analysis (FMEA) concept and system, defect analysis tools, sampling strategy and systems, Statistical Process Control (SPC) tools, Cycle Time Management, tableau creation, SQL and Programming language and Organizational Change have advantage.
• Keen to learn new skills, initiate proactive and continuous improvement projects, in areas across the Front-End including manufacturing methods and processes, quality, software systems, cycle time, key tool metrics (utilization, and performance efficiency), maintenance and routine tasks, and other manufacturing support operation.
• Good communication skill, maintain a strong and open relationship with peer group and appropriate team members in other functional areas such as Process Integration Engineering, Quality Systems, Production Operations Management and present strategy and updates to network members and leaders.
• Willing and capable of international travel, including Extended International Business Travel (EIBT) assignment to 6 months as needed, to accomplish the goals.
• Provide tactical support and coordination for the Fabs for issues of People, Safety, Yield, Quality, Cost, and Cycle Time when required.
• Relevant working experiences in RDA and/or Metrology Masters/bachelor’s in engineering Lead and facilitate discussion to drive network alignment on strategy business process and roadmap to achieve area objectives and deliver to timelines/commitments.
• Proficient in project management with good resource planning, status monitoring and deliver timely results.
• Be able to promote worldwide sharing and transfer of area-specific knowledge.
